name: Calculus I
description: This course focuses on functions, limits, continuity, derivatives, and their applications.

name: Calculus II
description: This course focuses on integration, techniques of integration, applications of integration, sequences, and series.

name: Multivariable Calculus
description: This course focuses on vectors, vector functions, partial derivatives, double and triple integrals, and their applications.

name: Differential Equations
description: This course focuses on first-order differential equations, second-order linear differential equations, power series solutions, and Laplace transforms.

name: Linear Algebra
description: This course focuses on systems of linear equations, vectors, matrices, determinants, eigenvalues, eigenvectors, and their applications.

name: Numerical Analysis
description: This course focuses on numerical methods for solving equations and systems of equations, interpolation and approximation of functions, and numerical integration and differentiation.

name: Probability Theory
description: This course focuses on probability, random variables, probability distributions, expectation, variance, covariance, and Central Limit Theorem.

name: Mathematical Statistics
description: This course focuses on inference, hypothesis testing, estimation, regression, and ANOVA.

name: Optimization
description: This course focuses on linear programming, integer programming, non-linear programming, and convex optimization.

name: Graph Theory
description: This course focuses on graphs, trees, connectivity, Euler and Hamiltonian cycles, planarity, and coloring.

name: Numerical Linear Algebra
description: This course focuses on linear systems, matrix factorizations, eigenvalue problems, and iterative methods.

name: Partial Differential Equations
description: This course focuses on first-order and second-order partial differential equations, separation of variables, Fourier series, and Fourier transforms.

name: Dynamical Systems
description: This course focuses on systems of differential equations, stability, bifurcations, chaos, and applications to physics and engineering.

name: Numerical Partial Differential Equations
description: This course focuses on finite difference and finite element methods for solving partial differential equations.

name: Applied Mathematics Seminar
description: This course focuses on literature review and presentation of current research topics in applied mathematics.
